description: A simple yet incredibly flavorful pizza featuring fresh mozzarella, ripe tomatoes, and fragrant basil on a crisp, thin crust.

steps.description: In a bowl, crush the San Marzano tomatoes by hand or with a potato masher. Add minced garlic, salt, and pepper. Mix well.

steps.step_name: Preheat Oven and Pizza Stone (if using)
steps.description: Preheat your oven to the highest temperature setting (usually 500-550°F or 260-290°C). If using a pizza stone, place it in the oven while preheating.
On a lightly floured surface, stretch or roll the pizza dough into a 12-14 inch circle or desired shape.

Carefully transfer the dough to a pizza peel dusted with cornmeal or flour. Spread a thin layer of tomato sauce over the dough, leaving a small border for the crust. Arrange mozzarella slices evenly over the sauce. Drizzle with olive oil.
Carefully slide the pizza onto the preheated pizza stone (or baking sheet). Bake for 8-12 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Remove the pizza from the oven and sprinkle with fresh basil leaves. Slice and serve immediately.

conclusion: Enjoy your delicious homemade Margherita Pizza! This recipe highlights the beauty of simple, high-quality ingredients for a truly satisfying meal.
